content: baby hat with pointy top supply list can be made with any yarn i recommend a soft sport yarn or worsted weight yarn hook appropriate for the yarn you use yarn needle to weave in ends measuring tape key single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch double_crochet decrease = double_crochet decrease notes do not turn unless the pattern tells you to do so this hat is worked in the round from the band up to the top of the hat photo note propeller is attached to a different hat pattern hat will look like flower and ball hats double_crochet decrease = double_crochet decrease = yarn over yo insert hook into double_crochet in previous row yo draw through yo draw through 2 loops yo insert hook into the next double_crochet in previous row yo draw through yo draw through 2 loops draw through 2 loops 2 more times until you are left with 1 loop on the hook band row 1 chain 6 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet in next 4 chain ch1 turn row 2-x* single_crochet into the back loops of each single_crochet chain 1 turn *where x = the desired circumference of the hat usually 11-12 for a newborn avg newborn head circumference is 13 -14 5 finishing the band fold band in half single_crochet across placing the hook through the back loops of the side of the band you just finished and the free loops of the beginning of the band this joins the two sides together to make the band body of hat row 1 turn the band so the loop created by the last single_crochet is on top chain 1 single_crochet around the edge of the band try to space your stitches evenly it does not matter how many stitches you have so there is no need to count your stitches as you work join with a slip_stitch to the first single_crochet row 2 chain 3 double_crochet in each single_crochet around the band join with a slip_stitch to the first double_crochet row 3-9 chain 3 double_crochet in each double_crochet around hat join with a slip_stitch to the first double_crochet at this point the hat should measure 3 - 3 ½ from scs around the top of the band depending on the length of the band if you have not reached this measurement please repeat the last row until you do reach 3 - 3 ½ row 10 chain 3 double_crochet decrease double_crochet around the hat join with a slip_stitch to the first double_crochet row 11-12 chain 3 double_crochet decrease repeat around the hat join with a slip_stitch to the first double_crochet repeat this row until the top of the hat is almost closed stop here if you do not want the pointy top row 13 ch1 single_crochet around join with a slip_stitch to the first single_crochet row 14 ch1 single_crochet around join with a slip_stitch to the first single_crochet slip_stitch across
